chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
R: stack sig
a: sig
x: list sig

Goal:
(exists A : list (card sig), A <<= R /\ A <> [] /\ sigma a A = x) <-> L G x

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
G = (S, (S, [S]) :: map (fun '(u, v) => (S, u ++ [S] ++ v)) R ++ map (fun '(u, v) => (S, u ++ [a] ++ v)) R) : sig * list (sig * list sig)
card = fun X : Type => (list X * list X)%type : Type -> Type Arguments card _%type_scope
L = fun (G : cfg) (x : list sig) => rewt G [startsym G] x /\ terminal G x : cfg -> list sig -> Prop Arguments L _ _%list_scope
stack = fun X : Type => list (card X) : Type -> Type Arguments stack _%type_scope
Notation sig := nat
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments
sigma = fix sigma (X : Type) (a : X) (A : CFP.stack X) {struct A} : list X := match A with | [] => [a] | (x, y) :: A0 => x ++ sigma X a A0 ++ y end : forall X : Type, X -> CFP.stack X -> list X Arguments sigma {X}%type_scope
Post_CFG_2 : forall x : list sig, rewt G [S] x -> exists (A : list (card sig)) (m : sig), A <<= R /\ sigma m A = x /\ (m = S \/ m = a /\ A <> [])
Post_CFG_1' : forall A : list (card sig), A <<= R -> A = [] \/ rewt G [S] (sigma a A)
CFPP = fun '(R, a) => exists A : CFP.stack sig, A <<= R /\ A <> [] /\ sigma a A = rev (sigma a A) : CFP.stack sig * sig -> Prop
CFPI = fun '(R1, R2, a) => exists A1 A2 : CFP.stack sig, A1 <<= R1 /\ A2 <<= R2 /\ A1 <> [] /\ A2 <> [] /\ sigma a A1 = sigma a A2 : CFP.stack sig * CFP.stack sig * sig -> Prop
PCPX = fun (X : Type) (P : stack X) => exists A : list (card X), A <<= P /\ A <> [] /\ tau1 A = tau2 A : forall X : Type, stack X -> Prop Arguments PCPX {X}%type_scope
iPCPb = fun P : stack bool => exists A : list sig, (forall a : sig, a el A -> a < | P |) /\ A <> [] /\ itau1 P A = itau2 P A : stack bool -> Prop
CFP = fun G : cfg => exists x : list sig, L G x /\ x = rev x : cfg -> Prop
in_flat_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (l : list A) (y : B), y el flat_map f l < -> (exists x : A, x el l /\ y el f x)
sym_G = fun G : cfg => startsym G :: flat_map (fun '(a, x) => a :: x) (rules G) : cfg -> list sig
ListEnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T_list : forall L : sig -> list ?X, ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' ?X L -> ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' (list ?X) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_list L) where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type]
incl_lcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), x :: A <<= B < -> x el B /\ A <<= B
sym_word_l : forall (R : stack sig) (u v : list sig), (u, v) el R -> u <<= sym R
sym_word_R : forall (R : stack sig) (u v : list sig), (u, v) el R -> v <<= sym R
CFI = fun '(G1, G2) => exists x : list sig, L G1 x /\ L G2 x : cfg * cfg -> Prop
sym_G_rewt : forall (x : list sig) (G : cfg) (y : list sig), x <<= sym_G G -> rewt G x y -> y <<= sym_G G
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), y el map f l < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ x el l)
MPCP = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack sig, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card sig * stack sig -> Prop
tau2_inv : forall (a : sig) (B : stack sig) (z : list sig), tau2 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list sig, (y, a :: x) el B
elt_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 : list A) (a b : A), l1 ++ a :: l2 = [b] -> a = b /\ l1 = [] /\ l2 = []
itau1_app : forall A B : list sig, itau1 ?P (A ++ B) = itau1 ?P A ++ itau1 ?P B where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type] ?P : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- stack ?X]
itau2_app : forall A B : list sig, itau2 ?P (A ++ B) = itau2 ?P A ++ itau2 ?P B where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type] ?P : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- stack ?X]
rewrite_sing : forall (R : cfg) (a : sig) (x : list sig), (a, x) el rules R -> rew_cfg R [a] x
incl_app_left : forall (X : Type) (A B C : list X), A ++ B <<= C -> A <<= C /\ B <<= C
incl_cons_inv : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l m : list A), a :: l <<= m -> a el m /\ l <<= m
sym = fix sym (R : stack sig) : list sig := match R with | [] => [] | (x, y) :: R0 => x ++ y ++ sym R0 end : stack sig -> list sig
tau2_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau2 (A ++ B) = tau2 A ++ tau2 B where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type]
tau1_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau1 (A ++ B) = tau1 A ++ tau1 B where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type]
terminal = fun (G : cfg) (x : list sig) => ~ (exists y : list sig, rew_cfg G x y) : cfg -> list sig -> Prop Arguments terminal _ _%list_scope
in_filter_iff : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (p : X -> bool) (A : list X), x el filter p A < -> x el A /\ p x = true
fresh_spec : forall (a : sig) (l : list sig), a el l -> fresh l <> a
